movie_title: Hottest week ever: BBC News Review
introduction: Hotter weather has never been recorded. The UN says that the first week of July had the highest aver

vocabulary.example: The new scientific discovery had a significant impact on the field of medicine.

vocabulary.definition: a heading at the top of an article or page in a newspaper or magazine
vocabulary.example: The headline of the newspaper read 'Breaking News: Earthquake Hits the City'.

vocabulary.definition: a figure of speech in which a word or phrase is applied to an object or action to which it is not literally applicable
vocabulary.example: Her smile was a ray of sunshine in my gloomy day - this is a metaphor comparing her smile to sunshine.

vocabulary.definition: smoothed or pressed with a heated iron
vocabulary.example: She ironed her dress before the important meeting to look neat and presentable.

vocabulary.definition: to express disapproval of someone or something
vocabulary.example: The film critic was quick to criticise the director's latest movie for its lack of originality.

vocabulary.definition: influenced or touched by an external factor
vocabulary.example: The community was greatly affected by the sudden change in government policies.
